page.title: 07SMITH FARM
page.content:
Smith Farm Continued
There are 18O sheep on the hill. These are counted by the Ministry of Agriculture every three years. They are also inspected when they are being dipped. Not all the sheep are sheared yet. The farmers in the area will join together and some men will come and shear all the sheep together. The sheep are Welsh sheep or Bualat on the hills. The ewes are kept, but the lambs are sold. There are three working dogs. Unless a certain brand of dip is used for the sheep then the lambs cannot be shipped abroad. Near Llandegfedd reservoir, Mr. Smith has sixteen acres of hay. They have cut 1,2OO already. Life on a farm is very healthy, but tied. Mr. Smith has not had a day off yet in 15 years.
